thread.title: William Hill blames UK tax as profits fall
thread.title_full: William Hill blames UK tax as profits fall

author: news.com.au
title: William Hill blames UK tax as profits fall
text:
BOOKMAKER William Hill says it took a STG44 million ($A92.94 million) hit from changes to the way the British government taxes online betting and gambling machines as it reported a slide in half-year profits.
RESULTS for the six months to the end of June showed pre-tax profits down 35 per cent to STG78.7 million, also impacted by one-off charges relating to its Australian operations.
Shares fell 5 per cent. Meanwhile, Hills announced that it was moving into the online lotteries market with the purchase of a 29 per cent stake in US-focused business NeoGames. The group said that its half-year results had been dragged down by the effect of the "point of consumption tax" on online gambling as well as the hike in duty on fixed odds betting terminals from 20 per cent to 25 per cent. It also said its "profit progression" had been hit by the Machine Games Duty increase, as well as new controls on the way customers who wish to stake more than STG50 on gaming machines may bet. Meanwhile, the group said the introduction of the National Living Wage for workers over 25 is expected to cost it STG1 million to STG2 million in 2016.
